text:
I'm looking for a function that will do the below. I came up with my own but would rather reuse something if it exists. Any suggestions?
```julia> a = [1, missing, missing, 2, 3, missing, 5, missing]
8-element Vector{Union{Missing, Int64}}:
 1
  missing
  missing
 2
 3
  missing
 5
  missing
julia> impute_missing_using_latest_non_missing(a)
8-element Vector{Union{Missing, Int64}}:
 1
 1
 1
 2
 3
 3
 5
 5
julia> ```

elements.text: I'm looking for a function that will do the below. I came up with my own but would rather reuse something if it exists. Any suggestions?

julia> a = [1, missing, missing, 2, 3, missing, 5, missing]
8-element Vector{Union{Missing, Int64}}:
 1
  missing
  missing
 2
 3
  missing
 5
  missing
julia> impute_missing_using_latest_non_missing(a)
8-element Vector{Union{Missing, Int64}}:
 1
 1
 1
 2
 3
 3
 5
 5
julia>

text: that just seems like a problem that calls for a loop

elements.text: that just seems like a problem that calls for a loop

text: yeah, but I thought something like `ShiftedArrays.lag` might be able to do this - turns out it doesn't. I think I may have seen similar functionality back when I was involved with writing R code

elements.text: yeah, but I thought something like
might be able to do this - turns out it doesn't. I think I may have seen similar functionality back when I was involved with writing R code

text:
```julia> f(x, ::Missing) = x;

julia> f(::Missing, x) = x;

julia> f(x, y) = y;

julia> accumulate(f, [1, missing, missing, 2, missing, 3, 2, missing])
8-element Vector{Union{Missing, Int64}}:
 1
 1
 1
 2
 2
 3
 2
 2```

elements.text:
julia> f(x, ::Missing) = x;

julia> f(::Missing, x) = x;

julia> f(x, y) = y;

julia> accumulate(f, [1, missing, missing, 2, missing, 3, 2, missing])
8-element Vector{Union{Missing, Int64}}:
 1
 1
 1
 2
 2
 3
 2
 2

text: Wow! <@UDD5Z7FLZ> I find that really slick, clean, and clever.

elements.text: I find that really slick, clean, and clever.
